Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: enbralva
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mondial in Berlin is place at the Kurfürstendamm, the most prestigious address in Berlin, very well situated. The hotel looks at first view a little bit old fashioned, even if everything is fine. The room I've got had two separated beds. Everything was OK, but I would nothing I would warmly recommend to my contacts. On the other side I paid approx 75 EUR per night, which is a good deal for the area of Berlin. The breakfast was as well acceptable. All in one: even if I haven't tried other **** hotels in the same area, I believe that Hotel Mondial is fully ok for people seeking a hotel with such a standard for a moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: oanach
Reviews.Content: Although it's not in Berlin Mitte, the hotel is well positioned right in the centre of Kufurstendamm strasse, a wide street full of shops. The conditions are great, except the fact that there is no AC...so, if you are palnning on going in summer, don't. Otherwise it's really worth a try. (lots of cheap restaurants and cafe also)

Reviews.Title: “Not responsive”
Reviews.Author: ShipDiner
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a corner room three nights. It was in September and we had a few warm days. The room was very hot and uncomfortable. The front desk was informed and I was told that "the air conditioning was on." After an hour of increasing heat, the front desk was again informed and a fan was requested. "There are no more fans," was the reply. They said that the heating and cooling could not be controlled in the rooms. Two hours later, the tour guide returned and told the front desk about the excessive heat in the room and apparently the control to the room was turned on. The room was never comfortable and after enduring the hot room, I opened the room windows. Previously I had been told to keep windows shut so the air conditioning would work. I won´t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: carpignano
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend who is disabled (in a scooter) and the hotel has wonderful accommodations for the disabled . The room was large and furnished with two single beds a desk and two comfortable chairs. Every consideration in the design of the rooms was considered for those in a wheelchair etc., and my friend was impressed with this. The staff at the hotel is friendly and it was a pleasure to stay there. The pool and sauna are also a plus. I have paid much more in Europe for less accommodating rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jack2502
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the Ku'dam and not far from the Uhlandstrasse U-bahn station with easy access across the transport system, making it an excellent location. It's a short walk to the Zoologischer Garten rail station with fast link to Schoenefeld airport. The hotel itself is well-furnished and comfortable with good standards of housekeeping and reception. The breakfast buffet is fairly extensive. On this visit, the hot food was rather lukewarm and some items on one day weren't replaced even though there was still an hour to go to the end of breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant looked rather quiet in the evenings and so we ate out, though there was a very good choice of possiblities nearby. I've stayed here before and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced connecting room - a boon for families”
Reviews.Author: Wibbering
Reviews.Content: After extensive research into hotels in Berlin for a family of four we were having difficulty finding a hotel that could provide a family room or two conecting rooms for a decent price. Then we found the Mondial. Berlin's not cheap but we got two large connecting rooms at a good price (they were listed as a family room but are actually two separate connecting rooms). Buffet breakfast included in the price AND a swimming pool (albeit a rather chilly one). This is an excellent choice for families in the Ku'damm area. Much grander than we'd hoped too. (Oh, and free Wi-Fi.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: twinklestar2307
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on business, nice room with a vew out the front, did wonder if this would be a problem sleeping, but didnt hear anything, Nice spacious bathroom with usual toiletries, restaurant wityh seats outside, waiter was a bit stroppy when I asked for a englsh menu, breakfast was buffet and filling. entral location, picked-up the tour bus outside the hotel. Did notice a few ladies with black eyes and a bit worse for wear, think there is a cosmetic clinic on site and the hotel used for recovery. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a sense of class”
Reviews.Author: Gary488
Reviews.Content: The Mondial is a wonderful hotel on the main shopping street of Berlin. It has an old worldly charm and is decorated accordingly. Im not sure if the furnishings are original but they had a feeling of what I imagine Bavaria was like. The breakfast was included in the price and was one of the best I have had in Europe. Everything you want from shops to Metro are all close by. Take a loved one here they will really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: hhsol
Reviews.Content: we were 4 ppl- 2 young kids + a baby, we got 2 connecting rooms, it was exelant, the food was good, the bar is nice, the pool is clean and cool, parking place is 12/5 per day, WIFI is free, the room could stand a light touch-up (the shower room )- but all in all it was great

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable European style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sun010
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel right on Kurfurstendamm Hotel Mondial is a good choice. We found front desk staff always very nice and helpful. We could even check in when we arrived at noon - very much appreciated! Had a room facing the back so there was no noise from the street at all. Room size was good with two armchairs, a table and a flat screen TV. Beds were a little hard but the cover was very cosy. There is no in room safe but you can use the safe in the reception for free. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was great, had everything we could wish for. We used the hotel pool and sauna one evening. It was clean and nice, but quite small. There was also just one shower for the ladies to share and afterwards you had to walk through the pool area to get to your locker. My overall impression is that Hotel Mondial is a comfortable hotel that provides what you are paying for - a four star Hotel experience. Just remember - Ku'Damm is a fashionable shopping street. If you are interested in the history and culture of Berlin, all the main sights are in the formal east, in a district called MItte.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but only for non-summer travel since thers is no AC!”
Reviews.Author: radiationmd
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Berlin this week. This hotel, shockingly, despite calling itself a four-star hotel, did not have air-conditioning!!! I, therefore, would personally not stay in this hotel during the summer when it is warm and humid; however, they do have heaters, so a stay during cold months, like ours, is just fine as far as this issue is concerned. Another MAJOR complaint I would have is the shower doors being only half the length of the bath tub and resulting in a messy wet bathroom floor after every shower. It amazes me to see these kinds of shower doors commonly in Europe,and I just don't know what they are thinking when they build them this way and the reasoning behind it. The third negative is the lack of free-internet access, and not even having a business center, again despite calling themselves 4****. You can borrow a laptop from them and get internet for a considerable fee. To the positives: The best feature of this hotel was its location. Besides being in the middle of Ku'dam, its accessibility from the airport was unbelievable. You can get to the Hotel from TX airport with just one bus (#109) which drops you off right in front of the Hotel and can go back the same way, and it will only cost you 2.1 Euros and take you about 20 minutes!! And the closest metro station is about 3 blocks (salvingiplatz), ie 5 minute walk and you can even walk to the Zoo train station within 15 minutes by foot. And the area is very safe and nice and you walk through shopping areas so the walk goes by quickly. The Room was very clean, but the first time I entered, the hotel did smell somewhat musty (mild) and humid and "old". The second time, I could not smell much maybe because my nose had become saturated, but, anyway, it was not bothering us anymore. The furniture is a little old and feels somewhat 70's and 80's, but surprisingly in pretty good shape . They don't have king beds, they put two twin beds next to each other and call it a " standard double"!! We stayed at three german hotels during our trip, and they were all this way. The breafast was very good and we pigged out on it every morning so much that we could not eat lunch and it was more like a brunch for us. Overall, by US standards, this is a 3-star hotel and not a four-star one. In the US, we probably would have paid around 150-200 dollars for this kind of accommadations in any US major city in non-peak times in mid-april, but we paid a 150 Euros per night, which given the exchange rate, came to around 250 dollars, so perhaps a little expensive for a 3*** hotel. Overall, however, we had a good stay and I would highly recommend this hotel for a non-summer stay, given the excellent location, the breakfast, and the nice staff, but definitely not when it is warm since there is no AC unless you can sleep in a hot and humid room or are ok with opening windows and don't mind the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkbpkb
Reviews.Content: I booked the mondial because of its location, the reviews on this website and the fact that it had a pool. Well, the pool is pretty small, so good for a wake-up splash in the mornings, really. The location is very good, being just by a tube stop on the Ku'Damm and within easy walking distance of good shopping and restaurants in Charlottenburg. The room was enormous, as was the bathroom, and looked out over the Ku'Damm. It was certainly better than average as far as size and comfort were concerned. One major disadvantage for any business traveller is that there is NO WLAN access in the rooms. This is only available in the lobby, so once the receptionist had entered the mac-address of my laptop on their network I was able to access the internet from the lobby. There were no tea & coffee making facilities in the room, so for a late-night coffee, it was necessary to ask for room service. A few times it seemed to me as though some of the staff were not naturally helpful as you might expect them to be in a hotel. That, as well as the non-internet access, was the negative of our stay. I would recommend this hotel, but probably not to business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: usfromdenmark
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Berlin – but not the last! We stayed 4 nights at Hotel Mondial in March. We had a double room booked via the hotel website, with breakfast included, for €140 per night. Great location – the hotel is situated right in the middle of all the exclusive and designer shops on the "Kurfurstendamm". The hotel has a nice reception and the staff is friendly, helpful and speaks English very well. The rooms are clean and very well equipped. The cost of the hotel was the same as others in the area but this one included breakfast and the breakfast was good with a choice of hot and cold buffet. The indoor pool was fantastic after a long walk in Berlin City – but unfortunately the sauna wasn’t working. It would have been nice to use it because of the weather - which was cold and very wet. In summary it’s a great hotel with good value for money. It’s ideally located in the city centre. We cannot recommend this hotel enough! It was a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect......”
Reviews.Author: Globetrooter
Reviews.Content: Been to Berlin 4 times and the hotels just seem to get better & better. Great location, right on Ku Dam. The all english speaking staff could not have been more helpful. A super hot buffet to start your day . Great sized bedroom complimented by high standards that you only expect from German hotels. Try Joes resturant for excellent food and great prices. Recommend the grilled Zander (fish) Planning to go back for the Xmas markets. Will stay at the same Hotel ... WILLIAM & PAULINE MCcULLOUGH BELFAST N. IRELAND

Reviews.Title: “very clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzysue2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an internet site for German hotels and wasn't dissappointed. The cost of the hotel was the same as others in the area but this one included breakfast. It was situated right in the middle of all the exclusive and designer shops on the "Kurfurstendamm" which is THE place to shop till you drop! Only a 2 minute walk to the S-Bahn and the U-bahn. Breakfast was plentiful and very good with choice of hot and cold buffet. Bar area was open until 2 am with an excepionally long happy hour! Reception staff couldn't have been more helpful, informing us of places to see and how to negotiate the underground system. Rooms were very clean and spacious as one would expect from German standards.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, reminds me of nice us hotel”
Reviews.Author: heavans
Reviews.Content: This is one of many hotels on Ku'Damm, my boyfriend and I thought it was very nice. Not too far down on Ku'Damm, so you can walk from the Zoologischer Garten S-Bahn. I guess pricier than others, but the room was really nice, good breakfast, really no complaints...

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mondial
HotelInfo.Address: Kurfurstendamm 47 | Charlottenburg, 10707 Berlin, Germany
